name: 華國媛
objective: The objective of this course is to illustrate the biomedical applications of photoelectric detection instruments.  This course will cover the discussion of the basic principles of optoelectronics and the knowledge of molecular biology (such as the introduction of the basic structure of deoxyribonucleic acid, ribonucleic acid, protein, or cell).
schedule:
Course Schedule:
Week 1: Introduction
Week 2: The application and future of Bio-optoelectronics
Week 3: Bio-optoelectronics and biosignaling
Week 4: Bio-optoelectronics and advanced Materials
Week 5: Molecular biology & Bio-optoelectronics - DNA, RNA
Week 6: Moolecular biology & Bio-optoelectronics - Protein
Week 7: Research papers review
Week 8: Research papers review
Week 9: Middle exam
Week 10: Biophotonics
Week 11: Bio-photonic detecting system
Week 12: Bio-inspired sensors
Week 13: Light-harvesting complex- phycobiliproteins
Week 14: Bioluminescence
Week 15: Applications of light in biomedical industry
Week 16: Quatum Dots
Week 17: Squeezing light for single-molecule spectroscopy
Week 18: Final Report
scorePolicy:
Midterm Exam (30%)
Final Exam (50%)
Class participation (20%)
